generif.text: Mutations in Tbx3 are responsible for ulnar-mammary syndrome (UMS), an autosomal dominant disorder affecting limb, tooth, hair, apocrine gland and genital development.
identification of a variant T-site as the essential TBX2/TBX3-binding element in the human p14(ARF) promoter
Results demonstrate the structural consequences of T-box domain protein 3 point mutations observed in Ulnar-Mammary syndrome and Holt-Oram syndrome patients.
The results are consistent with the previous finding that UMS is caused by haploinsufficiency of TBX3.
Overexpression of TBX3 is associated with breast cancer
increased expression of truncated cSHMT, Tbx3 and utrophin in plasma samples obtained from patients at early stages of ovarian cancer and breast cancer

A literature review of TBX3 combined with a novel TBX3 mutation in a family with ulnar-mammary syndrome finds an association in mutations that disrupt the TBX3 DNA-binding domain and a higher frequency of severe upper limb malformations and teeth defects.
Required for heart and limb formation, and is mutated in ulnar-mammary syndrome.
Data show that Tbx3 plays an important role in osteogenic differentiation and proliferation of human mesenchymal stem cells derived from adipose tissue.

Nyx2-5 confines recombinant hTBX3 expression to the sinoatrial node & sinus horns in mice. Tbx3 suppresses chamber differentiation--another mechanism by which the Tbx3-positive sinoatrial node is shielded from differentiating into atrial myocardium.
TBX3 repression to its targets is dependent on HDAC activity. TBX3 may serve as a biomarker for breast cancer.
Fluorescence in situ hybridization did not show major deletions or duplications at chromosome 22q11 as well as the TBX5/TBX3 region at 12q24.1.

Tbx2 and Tbx3 may play a dual role during the radial to vertical growth phase transition by both inhibiting senescence via repression of p21(CIP1) expression, and enhancing melanoma invasiveness by decreasing E-cadherin levels.
TBX3 mRNA expression was significantly higher in metastatic breast cancer than in non-metastatic tumors.
The mRNA and protein expressions of Tbx3 are markedly upregulated in breast cancer cell lines and tissue samples.

Tbx3 expression was found to be suppressed by AFLL when the expression of tumor suppressor genes p14 and p53 were activated
pathway that up-regulates TBX3 expression and provides additional evidence that increased levels of TBX3 contribute to metastasis.
Observational study and meta-analysis of gene-disease association. (HuGE Navigator)
Data show that estrogen signaling expands the pool of functional breast cancer stem-like cells through a paracrine FGF/FGFR/Tbx3 signaling pathway.
Study indicate mutation of TBX3 gene in the family.

In situ hybridization reveals Tbx3 and Sox4 to co-localize extensively in the embryo including the atrioventricular and outflow tract cushion mesenchyme and a small area of interventricular myocardium.
identify a Sp1 element and two CCAAT boxes to be essential for basal TBX3 promoter activity
Tbx3 overexpression promotes squamous carcinoma cell survival displaying an epithelial-mesenchymal transition phenotype.
TBX3 CPG island methylation predicts progression in bladder cancer.
TBX3 promotes human embryonic stem cell proliferation and neuroepithelial differentiation in a differentiation stage-dependent manner.
Data show that Tbx3 is up-regulated in tissue samples of head and neck squamous cell cancer (HNSCC) patients and that Tbx3 represses PTEN transcription.
the sequence variants within the TBX3 gene promoter did not contribute to VSD etiology.
Oncogenic B-RAF(V600E) signaling induces the T-Box3 transcriptional repressor to repress E-cadherin and enhance melanoma cell invasion.
TBX3 gene polymorphism is associated in the development of colorectal cancers.

Coimmunoprecipitations and immunofluorescence analyses confirmed the L2-TBX2 interaction and revealed that human papillomavirus 16 L2 also interacts with human TBX3, another member of the T-box family.
TBX3 exon 2 mutation is rare in most human tumors
TBX3 plays a pivotal role in mediating the antiproliferative and promigratory role of TGF-beta1 in breast epithelial cells and skin keratinocytes.
TBX3 may play an important role as a reciprocal switch between substrate dependent cell proliferation and tumour invasion.
Polymorphisms in several genes involved in the Wnt signaling pathway were associated with hepatic fibrosis or inflammation risk in HCV-infected males.
The pleiotropic effects of TBX3 mutations in humans and mice likely result from disrupting at least two molecular functions of this protein: transcriptional regulation and pre-mRNA splicing.
An enhancement in TBX3 protein expression both in glomerular and tubular regions.
Paracrine WNT signaling is stimulated by estrogen and progesterone, while autocrine WNT signaling is induced by the embryonic T-box transcription factor TBX3
Data show that the down-regulation of T-box transcription factor TBX2 by transforming growth factor beta I (TGF-beta1) is mediated by T-box transcription factor TBX3.

this new molecular-grade based on the combination of TBX2 and TBX3 methylation is an excellent marker for predicting progression to muscle-invasive bladder cancer in patients with primary pTaG1/2 bladder cancer.
TBX3 gene variants may contribute to indirect inguinal hernia as a rare risk factor by reducing TBX3 levels
Overexpression of Tbx3 is associated with pancreatic carcinoma.

These include a patient with hypoplastic phalanges and absent hallux bilaterally with de novo deletion of 11.9 Mb on 7p21.1-22.1 spanning 63 genes including RAC1, another patient with severe Holt-Oram syndrome and a large de novo deletion 2.2 Mb on 12q24.13-24.21 spanning 20 genes including TBX3 and TBX5, and a third patient with acheiropodia who had a nullizygous deletion of 102 kb on 7q36.3 spanning LMBR1

Study demonstrates that miR-206 directly targets Tbx3, that miR-206 and Tbx3 mRNA are inversely correlated in human breast cancer and that Tbx3 repression is necessary to elicit a significant functional effect of miR-206 in breast cancer cells.
genetic variation of Tbx3 is associated with left ventricular mass in a healthy Japanese population [meta-analysis]

TBX3 is not only required for development of posterior forelimb bones (ulna and digits 4 and 5), but also for a subset of posterior muscles (lateral triceps and brachialis) and their bone eminence attachment sites.
High TBX3 expression is associated with invasive breast cancer.
Tbx3 was found to be overexpressed in 46 of 98 human gastric cancer samples
The c.1423C>T (p.Q475*) nonsense mutation in exon 6 of the TBX3 gene associated with ulnar-mammary syndrome.
High TBX3 expression is associated with Hepatocellular Carcinoma.

Study demonstrates that TBX3 plays an essential role in papillary thyroid carcinoma (PTC) progression. TBX3 is able to promote cell proliferation and tumorigenesis of PTC possibly by facilitating the G1/S transition in the cell cycle.

Our results indicate that the R608W and R616Q variants of TBX2 as well as the A192T and A562V variants of TBX3 contribute to Conotruncal heart defects (CTDs)etiology; this was the first association of variants of TBX2 and TBX3 to CTDs based on a large population.
A de novo TBX3 mutation presenting as dorsalization of the little fingers: A forme fruste phenotype of ulnar-mammary syndrome.
TBX3 promotes progression of pre-invasive breast cancer cells in ductal carcinoma in situ by directly up-regulating SLUG expression and inducing epithelial mesenchymal transformation.

Although TBX3 and TBX18 do not play a significant role in promoting the enrichment and differentiation of HiPS into sinoatrial node-like cells, TBX3 shows a certain promoting trend, which can be further explored in the future.

Authors demonstrate that COL1A2 mediates the pro- and anti-migratory effects of TBX3 in chondrosarcoma and fibrosarcoma cells respectively. Data reveal that the AKT1/TBX3/COL1A2 axis plays an important role in sarcomagenesis.
Isoform-specific promotion of breast cancer tumorigenicity by TBX3 involves induction of angiogenesis.
The bioinformatic analysis identified TBX3 as a key regulator for the differentiation of cytotrophoblast into syncytiotrophoblast.
TOPK promotes epithelial-mesenchymal transition and invasion of breast cancer cells through upregulation of TBX3 in TGF-beta1/Smad signaling.
overexpression of TBX3 and HCN2 could reprogram human-induced pluripotent stem cells-derived cardiomyocytes into pacemaker-like cells
Differential DNA methylation patterns in human Schlemm's canal endothelial cells with glaucoma.
Transcription box3 protects human umbilical vein endothelial cells in a highglucose environment through sirtuin 1/AKT signaling.
Overexpression of TBX3 in human induced pluripotent stem cells (hiPSCs) increases their differentiation into cardiac pacemaker-like cells.
USP7 promotes proliferation of papillary thyroid carcinoma cells through TBX3-mediated p57(KIP2) repression.

TBX3 Promotes Melanoma Migration by Transcriptional Activation of ID1, which Prevents Activation of E-Cadherin by MITF.
A single-cell atlas of the healthy breast tissues reveals clinically relevant clusters of breast epithelial cells.
TBX3 and TBX5 duplication: A family with an atypical overlapping Holt-Oram/ulnar-mammary syndrome phenotype.
TBX3 induces biased differentiation of human induced pluripotent stem cells into cardiac pacemaker-like cells.
Loss of TBX3 enhances pancreatic progenitor generation from human pluripotent stem cells.
TBX3 regulates the transcription of VEGFA to promote osteoblasts proliferation and microvascular regeneration.
TBX3 stimulates proliferation and stem cell self-renewal in bladder carcinoma.
TBX3 activating PVT1 accelerates proliferation, migration, and invasion by modulating the miR-30a/LOX axis in anaplastic thyroid carcinoma.
Hierarchical deployment of Tbx3 dictates the identity of hypothalamic KNDy neurons to control puberty onset.
TBX3 Promotes Cervical Cancer Proliferation and Migration via HPV E6 and E7 Signaling.
Suppressed Cellular Senescence Mediated by T-box3 in Aged Gastric Epithelial Cells may Contribute to Aging-related Carcinogenesis.
TBX3 is dynamically expressed in pancreatic organogenesis and fine-tunes regeneration.
Intracellular mechanics and TBX3 expression jointly dictate the spreading mode of melanoma cells in 3D environments.
Proteostatic reactivation of the developmental transcription factor TBX3 drives BRAF/MAPK-mediated tumorigenesis.
Overexpression of TBX3 suppresses tumorigenesis in experimental and human cholangiocarcinoma.

name: T-box transcription factor 3

kegg.name: Signaling pathways regulating pluripotency of stem cells - Homo sapiens (human)

reactome.name: Transcriptional and post-translational regulation of MITF-M expression and activity

summary: This gene is a member of a phylogenetically conserved family of genes that share a common DNA-binding domain, the T-box. T-box genes encode transcription factors involved in the regulation of developmental processes. This protein is a transcriptional repressor and is thought to play a role in the anterior/posterior axis of the tetrapod forelimb. Mutations in this gene cause ulnar-mammary syndrome, affecting limb, apocrine gland, tooth, hair, and genital development. Alternative splicing of this gene results in three transcript variants encoding different isoforms; however, the full length nature of one variant has not been determined. [provided by RefSeq, Jul 2008].
